meanings.definition: The act of conditioning in advance.
meanings.sent1: The athlete's success was attributed to the rigorous preconditioning program.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian recommended preconditioning the pet before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The funny part of the movie was when the character tried preconditioning their cat for a talent show.
meanings.sent4: Her strict diet and exercise routine served as a preconditioning for the upcoming marathon.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules were a form of preconditioning for the students to follow instructions.

meanings.definition: A condition that must be fulfilled before something else can happen.
meanings.sent1: The completion of the safety checklist was a necessary preconditioning for starting the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The signing of the contract was a preconditioning for the project to proceed.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rainstorm created a funny preconditioning for the outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent4: The team meeting served as a preconditioning for the important presentation.
meanings.sent5: The arrival of the guests was the preconditioning for the surprise party to begin.
